property.value: A civil affairs officer speaking with local Afghan villagers

note.text: In rural areas, tension between secular and religious leaders can be high. Since the U.S. invasion, the official Afghan government continues to build its legitimacy, but its influence is not yet felt in villages, where tribal governance still plays a major role.

Identifying power brokers and discerning their intentions can be difficult, as insurgents can have influence in addition to religious and secular leaders. You will need to work to understand how various authorities affect decision making.
